subject: Business
title: Zombie Startups: The Living Dead
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Zombie Startups: The Living Dead.

hook.text: Your startup isn't growing, but it isn't dying. You're a zombie â€” alive but not really living.

buildup.text: Zombie startups generate just enough revenue to survive but never enough to scale.

discovery.text: Founders get trapped by sunk cost: years of work, loyal employees, a product that sort of works.

twist.text: The hardest decision in business is shutting down something that's merely okay.

climax.text: Investors call this the walking dead. No return, no failure, just limbo.

punchline.text: Sometimes the bravest move is pulling the plug.

quiz.question: What defines a 'zombie startup'?
options: It survives but never grows enough to scale or attract investors
It has no users at all
It was acquired by a larger company
